answers.answer: There is always a chance of early delivery.  Your uterus may measure at 36 weeks, but did they say if your due date with the baby's measurements matched the doctors calculated due date?  I would call or schedule an appointment with your doctor to voice your concerns, and don't leave until you get all the answers you need.  It may be second nature stuff to your doctor, but he needs to realize that it is all new to YOU!!!

Your doctor has to give you information, it is your right. You need to tell him this and if he won't, go someplace else. I don't know what it wrong, but I have heard of there being issues related to measuring a lot bigger than you are. I can help you find resources to read up on, if you want.

Okay, I'm doing a little research. What I've come up with so far is that it could be 1). gestational diabetes or 2). that the way you are carrying is why you're measuring bigger. But you said your doctor seemed concerned but wouldn't say anything? Trust your instincts and get a second opinion if he won't talk.

question: I am 30 weeks and 4 days pregnant, my uterus measures at 36 weeks pregnant and my baby is a little under weight for being almost 31 weeks along. (the doctor said so)I was just wondering if there's a chance i am going to have him early, and why i might be having this problem.the doctor looked concerned but he doesn't explain anything to me during visits. it's making me nervous.
title: responces needed ASAP!!
